STM: Intro to Comp Sci is proving to be a challenging course from the very beginning, causing some doubt about the choice of major or study path.
Overwhelmed by homework and the fast-paced academic environment of college life.

short_term: Seek feedback from peers for improvement

STM: Feeling a mix of excitement and loneliness with the new environment; missing high school friends and home-cooked meals.
Starting to form new friendships in class, finding comfort in shared experiences and the realization that many are in the same situation.

short_term: Join a new social group or club
long_term: Cultivate a wide network of supportive friends

STM: Concern over the quality and cost of dining hall food, affecting physical well-being.
Struggling with the adjustment to early morning classes and the overall sleep schedule.
Experiencing the high cost of living in NYC, particularly the price of coffee.
Feeling financially strained and reevaluating the perceived freedom of college life.

short_term: Start or increase contributions to retirement account
long_term: Invest in real estate or stocks

STM: Questioning the purpose of certain classes and their relevance to real life.
Experiencing an existential crisis, questioning happiness and the authenticity of social interactions.

short_term: Begin journaling to reflect on personal growth
long_term: Share insights through writing or speaking

STM: Frustration with coding assignments, particularly with Java, indicating a struggle with technology and programming.
Reflecting on how technology impacts daily life, especially in the context of college work and social interactions.

long_term: Stay ahead with emerging tech trends
